state Module¶

class state.BaseMDState(domain, potential, particle_pos_init=None, particle_vel_init=None, particle_mass_init=None, N=0, mass=1.0)[source]¶

Base molecular dynamics class.

Parameters:
  • domain (domain) – Container within which the simulation takes place.
  • potential (potential) – Potential to use between particles.
  • particle_pos_init (PosInit*) – Class to initialise particles with.
  • particle_vel_init (VelInit*) – Class to initialise particles velocities with.
  • N (int) – Number of particles, default 1.
  • mass (double) – Mass of particles, default 1.0.
K()[source]¶

Return Kenetic energy

N()[source]¶

Returns number of particles.

Q()[source]¶

Return Total energy

U()[source]¶

Return potential energy

U_set(U_in)[source]¶

Set a kenetic energy value.

accelerations()[source]¶

Return all particle accelerations.

accelerations_update()[source]¶

Updates accelerations dats using given looping method.

domain()[source]¶

Return the domain used by the state.

energy_kenetic()[source]¶

Calcluate and return kenetic energy.

masses()[source]¶

Return all particle masses.

positions()[source]¶

Return all particle positions.

potential()[source]¶
reset_U()[source]¶

Reset potential energy to 0.0

set_accelerations(val)[source]¶

Set all accelerations to given value.

Parameters:val (double) – value to set to.
velocities()[source]¶

Return all particle velocities.

class state.MassInitTwoAlternating(m1=1.0, m2=1.0)[source]¶

Class to initialise masses, alternates between two masses.

Parameters:
  • m1 (double) – First mass
  • m2 (double) – Second mass
reset(mass_input)[source]¶

Apply to input mass dat class.

Parameters:mass_input (Dat) – Dat container with masses.
class state.PosInitLatticeNRho(N, rho)[source]¶

Arrange N particles into a 3D lattice of density /rho. Redfines container volume as a cube with deduced volume, assumes unit mass.

Parameters:
  • N (int) – N, number of particles.
  • rho (double) – rho, required density.
reset(state_input)[source]¶

Applies initial lattice to particle positions.

Parameters:state_input (state) – object of state class. Inheritered from BaseMDState.
class state.PosInitLatticeNRhoRand(N, rho, dev=0.0)[source]¶

Arrange N particles into a 3D lattice of density /rho. Redfines container volume as a cube with deduced volume, assumes unit mass adds uniform deviantion based on given maximum.

arg int N:number of particles.
arg double rho: /rho, required density.
arg double dev:maximum possible random deviation from lattice.
reset(state_input)[source]¶

Applies initial lattice to particle positions.

Parameters:state_input (state) – object of state class. Inheritered from BaseMDState.
class state.PosInitTwoParticlesInABox(rx, extent=array([ 1., 1., 1.]), axis=array([ 1., 0., 0.]))[source]¶

Creates two particles a set distance apart on the given axis, centred on the origin. Places these within a containing volume of given extents.

Parameters:
  • rx (double) – Distance between particles.
  • extents (np.array(3,1)) – Extent for containing volume.
  • axis (np.array(3,1)) – axis to centre on.
reset(state_input)[source]¶

Resets the first two particles in the input state domain to sit on the x-axis the set distance apart.

Parameters:state_input (state) – State object containing at least two particles.
class state.VelInitNormDist(mu=0.0, sig=1.0)[source]¶

Initialise velocities by sampling from a gaussian distribution.

Parameters:
  • mu (double) – Mean for gaussian distribution.
  • sig (double) – Standard deviation for gaussian distribution.
reset(state_input)[source]¶

Resets particle velocities to Gaussian distribution.

Parameters:state_input (state) – Input state class oject containing velocities.
class state.VelInitTwoParticlesInABox(vx=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), vy=array([ 0., 0., 0.]))[source]¶

Sets velocities for two particles.

Parameters:
  • vx (np.array(3,1)) – Velocity vector for particle 1.
  • vy (np.array(3,1)) – Velocity vector for particle 2.
reset(state_input)[source]¶

Resets the particles in the input state to the required velocities.

Parameters:state_input (state) – input state.
